Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good neighbourhood, but...”
Reviews.Author: Maaamo
Reviews.Content: NOT central situation! Be prepared to use taxi, public transportation or rental car to get around. We were travelling with two small children and stayed in a Suite, a very nice room for families. Short walk to a small but very good supermarked, and approxomatly 20 min. walk to a area with several local restaurants. The breakfast included was a bit boring, but OK. Will say this hotel is better for groups and businesstravel, rather than for families travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: HiralP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week long conference and really enjoyed it. It's true that there is not much to do / see in the local vicinity (there didn't seem to be any restaurants or cafes nearby either). A taxi to central Madrid costs around €20. The rooms are really nice and modern with wood floors and comfortable beds, there is a speaker with a usb connection, but it didn't seem to work for me. The bathroom is also lovely and modern, the only slight strange thing being the floor of the shower - it's made of perforated metal, which is not very comfortable for standing on for very long. I would give it a 5, but knocked one point off as the room service / restaurant menu is very short and not very vegetarian-friendly. Also, there is an iron you can borrow, but the ironing board is a portable, tiny one, which makes ironing adult clothes quite tricky!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, friendly, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: Alan J
Reviews.Content: I often stay in Madrid on business but usually travel into the city from Alcobendas for a hotel. This visit did everything I wanted for a short business trip - comfortable, friendly, great pillows, working air con, didn't feel ripped off or rushed and I awoke to the sound of birds instead of traffic- I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “North of Madrid, modern hotel...”
Reviews.Author: kjconner
Reviews.Content: My parents booked rooms at this hotel over the phone, unaware of it's location or other specifics. We landed in Madrid only to find out my parents flight had been cancelled. I called the hotel and thankfully reached a fantastic front desk person named Magda. She was absolutely reassuring and understanding...just what I needed after long, hectic flights all the way from Alaska. She guided us there and helped me track down my parents alternate flight plan. Put me at ease completely. While waiting for my parents to arrive, we walked into the neighborhood near the hotel, found a little supermarket, farmacia, ATM, but not much else. The next day when my parents arrived, Magda gave us simple instructions on how to catch the bus into the city center. It was really not complicated, but we opted for a taxi on the way back. I enjoyed being away from the noise and fuss of the city. The rooms are very, very modern. A little too much for my liking. They were comfortable enough, but the glass bathroom walls were a bit much. Free mini bar made up for it some though. Breakfast room was well stocked and service very nice. All in all, very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: BlueDolphinBrussels
Reviews.Content: This is not a centrally located hotel but since I needed to be in this part of Madrid the location in this quiet and leafy area was perfect for me. I was frankly surprised by how stylish and comfortable my room was, including a comfortable chair for reading / watching TV. Good bed, nice, thick towels, generous shower - everything that mattered worked well. Friendly bar and the red wine I ordered was good quality, at the right temperature and fairly priced. Left early so cannot comment on breakfast, I did learn later that the hotel restaurant has a good reputation

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: urbanita76
Reviews.Content: It was the first time I visited the North of Madrid and I must say that I enjoyed my stay and I liked the quiet residential neighborhood the hotel is located at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisgarcia
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly for business and have to say that it is great. Very modern inside, good food and friendly staff make it a good place to stay. Not great for visiting the centre as it's a bit of a taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Much better”
Reviews.Author: Evil-Homer
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel many times over the years and to say it was getting a bit tired would be an understatement. Havind said that the new owners have given the interior a substantial facelift from which the whole place has benefitted no end. The rooms are now modern minamilist with great shower facilities, comfy beds and A/C that really works. Breakfast in the morning is pretty good too with a reasonable choice along the standard European lines. The only real drawback is they shut the bar at around midnight with no warning whatsoever, in fact they just switched the lights out on the terrace where we were sitting, so a major minus on that front.
